comments:
Test scenario JVESYNC01 - Test source code synchronization.

Create a new visual class that extends JFrame. Change the contentpane's layout 
to a FlowLayout. Drop a few components (e.g. JButton, JCheckBox) onto the 
contentpane. In the source viewer, select and cut the getJContentPane() method 
and use the arrow keys to move quickly up/down in the source viewer to paste it 
to a different location. Before you can paste in back, the graph viewer does a 
reload from scratch and the cursor inside the source viewer is gone so I could 
no longer navigate or type. I had to use the mouse to select the source viewer 
and paste the method back into the source

Found the following stack trace in the .log:
java.lang.InstantiationException: IWAV0125E "getJContentPane()" is too

The exception below results from the fact that when you remove the
getContentPane() method, you still have:
   this.setContentPane(getJContentPane());

Since codegen can not resolve the call to getJContentPane() anymore, it punts it
to the target VM giving it a chance to resolve this dynamically (e.g. static
Factory)... the exception below is marked as a warning... but the logger just
put a status of "2".  We can improve our logging in this case so that the VE
logger append "Info" on these type of errors:
EclipseLogMsgLogger.primLogStatus() can replace the Status with a new one, by
appending "Informational" to the Status msg. before calling
getPluginLog().log(status)


Could not recreate the cursor lost problem.
We're using future now instead of resolve later

FYI: We no longer get log messages. We get the simple can't process
getJContentPane() on the little warning ticky on the flag.

However, when we do finally paste it back in, it is not recognized as now being
a child of the frame. It does reparent all of its children back from the
freeform onto the content pane, but the content pane is not made a child of the
frame.

You need to do a reload to get it process this.

traces.message: IWAV0125E "getJContentPane()" is too  complicated to be evaluated
